When using logistic regression with L1 regularization, the regularization term adds a penalty to the absolute value of the coefficients. As the value of C increases, the regularization term becomes more severe, causing the coefficients to shrink towards zero. The coefficient of the non-zero feature will not become zero until the coefficient of the other feature becomes zero. Therefore, the first feature to become zero is the one with the smallest coefficient, which is w2 in this case. Once w2 becomes zero, w1 becomes the only non-zero coefficient and continues to shrink towards zero as well.
